page.title: 15Cotswold Edge (1)
page.content: Across the golf course from Prinknash is the Painswick Beacon,a view which stretches across the Stroud Valley.An open place which peaks over Painswick. Painswick itself was created in the 11th and 12th centuries.This village was once an industrial area.It is hard to believe with it's valley's and churches.It was famous for it's 18th century clothiers houses,tombs,church_ yards and the mills on the local streams. There is a house of one of the Loveday family(now the vicarage),Loveday's mill on the stream and Loveday family tombs by the north door of the church.There are also weavers homes in Vicarage Lane.These people worked for 16 hours a day and there were many unemployed.The Painswick people were said to be "too poor to live and too healthy to die".
